entry.title: Ernest J. King (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to a popular myth, Admiral Ernest J. King (pictured) shaved with a blowtorch?

entry.title: "Lunch" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Billie Eilish first served "Lunch" during a party at Coachella?

entry.title: Han Bong-zin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that footballer Han Bong-zin trained in the military every day for four years in preparation for the FIFA World Cup?

entry.title: Sud 777 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a critic said that the hors d'oeuvres served at Sud 777 could function as desserts and vice versa?

entry.title: Tatto Suwarto Pamuji (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after completing his tenure as regent, Tatto Suwarto Pamuji walked 96 kilometres (60 mi) to fulfill a vow he made?

entry.title: Florida Hospital Oceanside (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Florida Hospital Oceanside was demolished after being damaged by Hurricane Irma?

entry.title: Jean-Pierre Lévy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that youthful Second World War resistance leader Jean-Pierre Lévy was advised by the Free French intelligence service to dye his hair grey to appear older?

entry.title: Żeromski Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Żeromski Park, the second-largest park in Szczecin, Poland, used to be a cemetery?

entry.title: Growing Up (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on American band the Linda Lindas' first album, Growing Up, a cat named Lil' Dude is featured playing the piano?
